intro: Navarretia torreyella, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of silver-gray leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. This plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in meadows and open slopes. It has a short growing season and is adapted to cold climates, blooming in early spring. Navarretia torreyella is also known for its ability to form dense colonies, contributing to the ecological stability of its habitat.
